description.narrative: WSR would use this grant to fund the stipends for two case management workers, which is currently only funded through the March 16, 2018 . Currently, our case managers handle a caseload of 148 households (we receive calls each week of new families in need but without long term stability cannot responsibly extend our services further) and are tasked with connecting these families to agencies, organizations, and opportunities providing support and resources to aid their recovery. From surplus building materials to legal aid offered for mishandled FEMA claims, our case managers are focused on helping families in WSR’s database to navigate a landscape of both opportunities and obstacles. Additionally, the relationships maintained between WSR and affected residents through this case management effort allows us to make an informed contribution toward discussion with traditional aid agencies (e.g., United Way, Baker Ripley, Catholic Charities, etc.) about the areas in which their processes are failing or falling short. WSR also encourages certain residents identified by case management to attend public hearings and planning sessions that will shape how Harvey recovery funds are allocated and delivered.
